com.oceanoptics.omnidriver.features.buffer

Interface DataBuffer


  • public interface DataBuffer
    This interface encapsulates functions in devices that have a data buffer. The buffer is capable of storing x amount of spectrum for immediate retrieval. The benefit of a data buffer is to prevent missed spectrum due to latency inherent on a PC using an I/O port.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      void abortAcquisition()
      Abort current acquision on device.
      void clearBuffer()
      Causes the data buffer to immediately flush its contents and go back to an empty state.

      Queries the minimum number of data elements that the buffer can store.
      int getNumberOfElements()
      Queries the total number of data elements currently stored in the buffer.

      Determine the status of the data buffer enable control.

      Limits the number of data elements that the buffer should store.
      void startAcquisition()
      start acquision on the device.

    • Method Detail

      • clearBuffer

        void clearBuffer()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Causes the data buffer to immediately flush its contents and go back to an empty state.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is any problem commanding the device to clear its data buffer

      • getBufferCapacity

        int getBufferCapacity()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Queries the current data buffer limit in the device.
        Returns:
        The number of data elements that are currently allowed to accumulate before the device begins to discard or overwrite them according to its own settings.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem executing the query.

      • getBufferCapacityMaximum

        int getBufferCapacityMaximum()
        Queries the maximum number of data elements that the buffer can store. This can be used to bound the parameter to {#@link setBufferCapacity(int)}.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of data elements that the buffer can ever store at any given time. maximum buffer size

      • getBufferCapacityMinimum

        int getBufferCapacityMinimum()
        Queries the minimum number of data elements that the buffer can store. This can be used to bound the parameter to {#@link setBufferCapacity(int)}.
        Returns:
        The minimum number of data elements that the buffer can ever store at any given time. maximum buffer size

      • getNumberOfElements

        int getNumberOfElements()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Queries the total number of data elements currently stored in the buffer.
        Returns:
        The number of data elements presently stored in the buffer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is some problem executing the query.

      • setBufferCapacity

        void setBufferCapacity(int bufferSize)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Limits the number of data elements that the buffer should store. Once the buffer reaches capacity, new data may be discarded or overwrite existing entries according to the device's settings. Note that setting the buffer size may cause some or all data in the buffer to be discarded.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - The number of data elements that the buffer will be allowed to store at once. Note that this must not exceed the value given by {#@link getBufferCapacityMaximum()}.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem setting the buffer limit.

      • abortAcquisition

        void abortAcquisition()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Abort current acquision on device. This call does not affect acquisitions already applied to the buffer. Follow this call with a clear buffer command.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem setting the abort acquisition.

      • startAcquisition

        void startAcquisition()
               throws java.io.IOException
        start acquision on the device. This call does not affect acquisitions already applied to the buffer. Follow this call with a get spectrum command.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem setting the start acquisition.

      • enableBuffer

        void enableBuffer(boolean value)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Provide the capability to turn the data buffer "on" or "off".
        Parameters:
        value - the set value for data buffer enable control.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem setting the data buffer enable control

      • isEnableBuffer

        boolean isEnableBuffer()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Determine the status of the data buffer enable control.
        Returns:
        true if enabled otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem getting the data buffer enable status.
